intro: Ternstroemia candolleana, commonly known as the Himalayan stonecrop, is a perennial shrub native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid mountain environment. It produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
